conclusion: Determine how shadows will change when light source moves to back left above objects
Light source currently casts shadows to the right and slightly forward of objects
Light source moves to back left above objects, casting shadows towards lower right
Shadow A will shift to lower right of cloth, extending towards bottom right corner
Shadow B will move to lower right of mirror, extending diagonally towards bottom right
Shadow C will shift to lower right of ring, extending towards bottom right
Shadow D will move to lower right of avocado, extending diagonally towards bottom right
All shadows will shift to lower right of objects, elongated in direction of new light source
Final answer: Shadows A, B, C, and D shift to lower right of objects, extending diagonally towards bottom right
